processed_hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ali: A man came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ during Ramadan and said: 'O Messenger of Allah ﷺ, I am destroyed!' The Prophet ﷺ said: 'What is the matter with you?' He said: 'I approached my wife (with unlawful intercourse) while overpowered by desire until I did the act.' So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Do you find the capacity to free a slave?' He said: 'No, by Allah, I never owned any creature.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Then fast two consecutive months.' He said: 'No, by Allah, I do not have the strength for it.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Then go and feed sixty poor people.' He said: 'No, by Allah, I do not have the strength for it.' Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ ordered for him fifteen sacks, with each poor person receiving a measure. He said: 'O Messenger of Allah ﷺ, by the One Who sent you with the truth as a prophet, there is no household between the two boundaries of this city more needy than ours!' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Then take it and feed yourself and your family with it.'

Ali said: 'We have not fasted except for twenty-eight days.' Then he called them and called for the Quran and adjured them by Allah and by what is in it of the Mighty Quran that they were not lying. Then he ordered the people to break their fast and ordered them to make up one day, and ordered the people that they should go out on the next day to their prayer-place, because they had testified after the sun's decline.

processed_hadiths.english_translation: From Ali: (Discussion on expiation of oaths) The Prophet's ﷺ guidance on giving sustenance - providing breakfast and dinner half a measure of wheat, semolina, flour, or a measure of dates or barley. Regarding Allah's statement 'from what you feed your families' - the moderate includes bread with butter or oil, the best being bread with meat, and the least being bread with salt. Regarding clothing - providing a garment sufficient for prayer. (From Zaid ibn Ali's discussion): When a man swears by Allah - by Allah, with Allah, or by Allah - then breaks his oath, he must expiate. If he says 'I swear' or 'I testify' without mentioning Allah, there is no breach. If he says he is Jewish, Christian, Magian, or disbelieves in Islam then breaks his oath, there is nothing upon him. If he says 'I have a vow if I speak to so-and-so' and speaks to him, there is nothing upon him unless he says 'For Allah I have a vow.' Details regarding different types of oaths and their expiations. If a man can only find one poor person, he cannot distribute ten days of food to him as one (it only counts as feeding one). If a man breaks his oath while poor and fasts, then finds provisions on the third day before sunset, his fasting is annulled and he must provide sustenance instead. The people of the covenant cannot be given expiation-required foods. Various rulings on swearing oaths regarding food transformations - that distinction is made between substantial change and appearance change. Questions about oaths sworn by children who later mature, or by disbelievers who later convert - Islam nullifies what came before it. The basis of people's oaths is according to their intention and custom of their land.

processed_hadiths.english_translation: From Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Whoever desires both this world and the Hereafter, let him visit this House (Ka'bah). Whatever servant comes to it asking Allah for worldly provisions, Allah gives him from it. And whoever asks Him for the Hereafter, He stores it up for him. O people! Undertake Hajj and Umrah and follow between them, for indeed they wash away sins as water washes away dirt from cloth, and they eliminate poverty as fire eliminates impurity from iron.
